functions.meaning: Parent of this node in a compositional hierarchy.
functions.name: parent

functions.meaning: The item at a path (relative to this item); only valid for unique paths, i.e. paths that resolve to a single item.
functions.name: item_at_path

functions.meaning: List of items corresponding to a non-unique path.
functions.name: items_at_path

functions.meaning: True if the path exists in the data with respect to the current item.
functions.name: path_exists

functions.meaning: True if the path corresponds to a single item in the data.
functions.name: path_unique

functions.meaning: The path to an item relative to the root of this archetyped structure.
functions.name: path_of_item

meta_info.description: The `PATHABLE` class defines the pathing capabilities used by nearly all classes in the openEHR reference model, mostly via inheritance of `LOCATABLE`. The defining characteristics of `PATHABLE` objects are that they can locate child objects using paths, and they know their parent object in a compositional hierarchy. The parent feature is defined as abstract in the model, and may be implemented in any way convenient.
meta_info.name: PATHABLE
